title: Chief Technology Officer (They/She/He)
content:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. A ride that will fuel your ambitions and make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. At Glovo, we believe in paving the way forward together!
Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia, where we operate in +3000 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales and over 20M customers get their good delivered in minutes. 
Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.
What makes our ride unique? 
ü§ù Our culture and strong values. 

We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! 
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! 
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way.  We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). 
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. 

üí™Our career development philosophy. 

We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. 
We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! 
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. 

ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. 

Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. 
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. 
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.
YOUR MISSION:
Hello candidate, Oscar here!
I‚Äôm extremely excited for the next two years in Glovo Tech and I‚Äôd like to tell you why. The last three years have been all about scaling (it was hire, hire, hire time!) and building the foundations. We have achieved strong platform stability, a very solid culture and engagement levels, good talent density and created an employer tech brand that is now attracting top notch talent across the globe. 
After 8 years since I founded Glovo, I would say things are now finally well oiled and moving at decent speed. The important stuff gets well prioritized and things get shipped. However, to cope with our business ambition, we want to speed up tech. I firmly believe we can 2-3x our product velocity with better ways of working, accountability and talent density. Achieving this, while keeping a fun, engaging and challenging place to work, is the #1 mission for our future CTO. 
I am really looking forward to start working closely with you!
IN THE JOURNEY YOU WILL

Embrace Passion and Energy: Continue driving a fast, responsive approach to organisational needs, promoting a "YES" attitude, prioritising speed over perfection, and approaching challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
Obsess with product velocity: we believe we can still 2x our product velocity through better ways of working, alignment and tooling.
Uphold Values and Culture: Advocate for a high talent bar, accountability, ownership, efficiency, speed and a stance against entitlement, aligned with Glovo's core values.
Lead with Curiosity: Stay abreast of new technologies and developments, driving innovation and embracing emerging opportunities. 
Continue Raising the bar: Show continued obsession with increasing talent density, keeping high engagement and implementing programs that nurture team excellence. 
Continue building Glovo‚Äôs Tech Brand: Continue efforts to position Glovo as a leading tech employer in Europe, with a focus on high bar.
Demonstrate Approachable Leadership: Balance high standards with an understanding, reasonable approach that challenges and supports the team, sharing context and encouraging open dialogue.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE RIDE

Strong emotional intelligence: You are relatable and inspire as a confident leader.
Positive Attitude and a collaborative mindset: Known for energetic, positive approach, ease of collaboration and calm under pressure. 
Results-Driven Approach: A proven track record of strong contributions, acting with a clear ambition to build a reference brand and displaying high results aligned with company values
Office-first mindset: Commitment to a fast-paced, high-growth environment, with a shared belief in the benefits of time spent in the office every week.
Innovation and Learning Mindset: Contagious curiosity about new technologies, defying the status quo and committed to continuous learning.
Tech Excellence Focus: Track record of continuously pushing platform availability and maturity ahead of the curve.
Alignment with our values
Ability to attract top talent: The pull to attract exceptional talent globally, scale high-performance teams, and foster growth and retention.
Understanding of business: Commitment to swift product shipping and efficient problem-solving while understanding operational challenges and technical architecture.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.
We believe driven talent deserves:

üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings with zero delivery fees on all Glovo orders!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏èFlexible time off (uncapped vacation days) , the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, including nursery support.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.
üìö An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.

Here in Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard. 
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 
Delve into  our culture by taking a peek at our  Instagram and checking out our Linkedin and website!

When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by GlovoApp23, S.L. (“Controller”), which is located at C/ Pujades 94, 08005, Barcelona, Spain. Controller’s data protection officer belongs to the legal team and can be contacted at legal@glovoapp.com. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of the Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, contacting previous companies where the applicant has been employed in order to check references (upon prior consent from the applicant), evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and, as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes - such may be analyzing your skills for the proposed role, The Controller may also use your data to present different roles that may suit your interests and/or skills. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(a), (b) and (f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) based on the consent of the applicant by submitting the application, as necessary for the purposes of conducting precontractual activities, directly requested by the applicant by submitting the candidature, addressed to analyse the possibilities of establishing a labour relation between the Controller and the applicant, and for the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the application, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.
Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc. of whom are a cloud services and applicant tracking provider located in the United States of America and engaged by the Controller to help manage their recruitment and hiring processes. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it to this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that the United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under either the standard contractual clauses and/or the Privacy Shield. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at legal@glovoapp.com. At the same time, your data and the inputs of the recruitment process will be stored on Google, Inc and Amazon Web Services servers, acting as processors, both of which comply with the General Data Protection Regulations and have a written agreement with the Controller. Depending on the offer applied, your personal information may be transferred to other companies of the Controller’s group for the same purposes as established before and acting as a processor.
Your personal data will be retained by the Controller as long as needed to fulfil the requirements of the above mentioned purposes. In case the recruitment process does not end with the establishment of a labour relationship between the applicant and the Controller, the Controller will retain the applicant’s data for a period of 3 years from the date of the last communication, issued either by You or the Controller, declaring the end of the recruitment process without sending and/or accepting the possible offer.
Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified, cancelled or erased, and/or to request that processing of your personal data be limited. In case You consider your rights have been violated, you also have to right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority. By consenting and submitting the candidature, the applicant confirms that they have read and are informed about the processing of personal data by the Controller and gives the necessary consent to comply with Controller’s activities regarding the recruitment process.
